author: kinman
msg: - Implements name-from-attribute and alias in variable directives in tag file

author: luehe
msg: Treat "UTF-16", "UTF-16BE", and "UTF-16LE" as identical when comparing
- the detected XML encoding of a JSP document
(as per section 4.3.3 of the XML specification),
- the encoding specified in the 'pageEncoding' attribute of the page
directive of the JSP document, and
- the encoding specified in a JSP configuration
element whose URL pattern matches the document.
This fixes JSP 2.0 TCK test "i18nXmlPageResponseEncodingTest".

author: luehe
msg: Fixed 16127 ("Seems to be a problem doing a static include of content
when using a different charset.")
In addition, the presence of an XML prolog no longer implies a JSP
document, as it may actually be used with standard syntax to produce
an XML-formatted result (in which case Jasper must treat the XML
prolog as template text).

author: glenn
msg: Dereference those objects which are only used during the generation
of the java class from the JSP source or used during the javac compile.
This should reduce the memory footprint of Tomcat in production for
those who use JSP and where JSP pages get compiled or recompiled on
a production system. This should also improve performance by reducing
the number of objects in the old generation, thus reducing GC overhead.
